summary: This is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, dated August 8, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate counts, movements, and administrative actions across three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). The log records inmate transfers, medical trips, court appearances, and the placement of one inmate on suicide watch. It is significant as it documents the operational environment of the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held, on the day before his death.

events.title: Routine Prison Operations and Inmate Movements
events.description: Standard daily operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including multiple inmate counts, body alarm tests, inmate transfers to/from court and hospital, new commitments, releases, and administrative actions like placing an inmate on suicide watch.

events.title: Inmate Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Inmate Bright (#76309-054) was placed on suicide watch during the Evening Watch shift.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: This log documents routine operations at the MCC New York on August 8, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility.
The log shows standard procedures like inmate counts, equipment checks, and inmate movements for court, hospital, and transfers.
One inmate, Bright (#76309-054), was placed on suicide watch during the evening shift.
The log indicates operational issues, including a malfunctioning public address system that prevented PREA announcements.
The document provides a snapshot of the prison's population and administrative status but contains no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein or any events related to his case.
